Test Case Title: The manager can't log in leaving all fields empty
Test Steps:
1- Leave the UserID field empty.
2- Leave the password field empty.
3- Click on the "Login" button.
Expected Result:
The system should display An error message 
"User is not valid".

Test Steps:
1- Click on the User-ID field.
2- Leave the UserID field empty.
3- Move to the next field.
Expected Result:
The system should display An error message 
"User-ID must not be blank".

Test Steps:
1- Click on the password field.
2- Leave the password field empty.
3- Move to the field above.
Expected Result:
The system should display An error message 
"Password must not be blank".

Test Case Title: The manager cannot log in by entering an invalid UserID.
Test Steps:
1- Enter an invalid UserID.
2- Enter a valid password.
3- Click on the "Login" button.
Expected Result:
The system should display An error message 
"UserID is not valid".

Test Case Title: The manager cannot log in by entering an invalid password.
Test Steps:
1- Enter a valid UserID.
2- Enter an invalid password.
3- Click on the "Login" button.
Expected Result:
The system should display An error message 
"Password is not valid".

Test Case Title: The manager/customer can reset the data if the UserID is only filled.
Test Steps:
1- Enter a valid UserID.
2- Leave the password field empty.
3- Click on the "Reset" button.
Expected Result: The system should reset the data successfully.

Test Case Title: The manager/customer can reset the data if the password is only filled.
Test Steps:
1- Leave the UserID field empty.
2- Enter a valid password.
3- Click on the "Reset" button.
Expected Result: The system should reset the data successfully.

Test Case Title: The manager/customer can reset the data if all fields are filled.
Test Steps:
1- Enter a valid UserID.
2- Enter a valid password.
3- Click on the "Reset" button.
Expected Result: The system should reset the data successfully.

Test Case Title: The manager/customer can reset the data if all fields are empty.
Test Steps:
1- Leave the UserID field empty.
2- Leave the password field empty.
3- Click on the "Reset" button.

Test Case Title: The manager can log in providing valid credentials.
Test Steps:
1- Enter a valid UserID.
2- Enter a valid password.
3- Click on the "Login" button.
Expected Result: The system should redirect the manager to the home page of the registered account.
